abstract.value: The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal <emph render="italic">Radical Philosophy Review</emph>, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, websites, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

p.value:
To cite the archived website in this collection:
Identification of item, date; Collection Name; Collection Number; Wayback URL; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

http://home.grandecom.net/~jackgm/RPA.html was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2008 as part of the Other Left Activism Web Archive. In 2012, http://www.radicalphilosophyassociation.org/ was added to the web archive. In 2015, these websites were migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2018, https://www.rpamag.org/ was added to the web archive. The accession number associated with this website is 2019.106.

Founded in 1982, the Radical Philosophy Association is an international organization whose members struggle against capitalism, racism, sexism, homophobia, disability discrimination, environmental ruin, and all other forms of domination, drawing upon a variety of radical traditions including phenomenology, Marxism, anarchism, post-structuralism, post-colonial theory and environmentalism. Its efforts center on conferences and publications. The RPA also publishes the journal <emph render="italic">Radical Philosophy Review</emph>.

The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal <emph render="italic">Radical Philosophy Review</emph>, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, websites, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

Scope and Content Note

Founded in 1982, the Radical Philosophy Association is an international organization whose members struggle against capitalism, racism, sexism, homophobia, disability discrimination, environmental ruin, and all other forms of domination, drawing upon a variety of radical traditions including phenomenology, Marxism, anarchism, post-structuralism, post-colonial theory and environmentalism. Its efforts center on conferences and publications. The website contains their newsletter, call for papers, information on their upcoming and previous conferences, and press releases and statements on Angela Davis, Academic Freedom, Afghanistan, Iraq, Anti-Intervention Project, Colombia, and anti-racism. The RPA also publishes the journal Radical Philosophy Review. The collection also includes the website for their online publication, RPA Mag.

Accruals

New site crawls are accrued semiannually.

Appraisal

Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of radicalphilosophyassociation.org and rpamag.org in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
